General Manager
January 11, I960
Mr. Harry Skornia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
lh Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Telephone
Dear Harry:
We are working on a research project to submit to the
Defense Education Act. We hope to meet the February 1st
deadline for Title VII Proposal. This project that we
are planning will call for the use of audio tape recordings
and we will need to have them duplicated in rather large
numbers. I know that you have the equipment for making these
duplicates for the tape network, but I don’t know whether
or not ycu ever contract to do other recording duplication.
If so, I would like to get some information about your
rates. For instance, what would the cost be to have two
fifteen-minute tapes duplicated, each week for thirty-five
weeks? Of course, the number of duplications would be
important and I am assuming that we would need in the
neighborhood of sixty copies of each.
Of course all this is tentative, but we do have to have
some idea of where we could get tapes copied and how
much it would cost for the job. Perhaps this is a much
more complicated question than it appears. If so, let
me know whether or not you can contract for this kind of
work and, if you can, I will call and talk with you about
it on the phone.
One other item I may as well enclose with this letter. Over
the week-end I started to draft a letter to McPherson at
the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare. He is
the Chief of the Dissemination and Services section. I
had contacted him earlier about dissemenation contracts and
in his reply to me he suggested that an outline of my
